node.title: People urged to stay out of water in Matua after wastewater overflow
node.description: The overflow was caused by an electrical fault at a pump station.
node.content: ["Beachgoers and swimmers in Matua are being urged to stay out of the water and avoid collecting shellfish after a wastewater overflow on Saturday.\u00a0", "The Tauranga City Council said the overflow in the Fergusson Park area in the Bay of Plenty was caused by an electrical fault at a pump station.\u00a0", "Council contractors have stopped the overflow and cleaned up the affected area with the cause of the electrical fault under investigation.\u00a0 \u00a0", "Water quality testing will be carried out to ensure there is no ongoing impact.\u00a0", "Warning signs are also in place along the Fergusson Park foreshore and boat ramp.\u00a0\u00a0", "The Council is taking a precautionary approach and \"advises people to please stay out of the water and avoid collecting shellfish until test results show it's safe to do so again\"."]
